intro: Navarretia bowmaniae, commonly known as Bowman's navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Navarretia bowmaniae is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
